title: Benvenuto de la Serna 2016 Mil Piedras Cabernet Sauvignon (Vista Flores)
description: Plum and berry aromas are clean and tight. This wine has an iron grip and rock-hard tannins to frame hammering black-fruit flavors. Salty notes rise up on a hard finish that's consistent with the palate.

title: Bodega Classica 2015 el Pacto  (Rioja)
description: Volatility is an issue on an otherwise flat, jammy nose. Hard tannins and full extraction create roughness on the palate. Flavors of clove and cinnamon come straight from the barrel, and it's jagged on a pounding finish.

title: Bodegas Paniza 2016 Viura (Cariñena)
description: Apple and citrus aromas are spunky but briny and stalky. This basic Viura has good body, with bright acidity. Sweet lime and citrus-peel flavors hold steady on the finish.

title: Callaway 2015 Calliope Red (Temecula Valley)
description: Light in color, this blend's red-currant and cranberry aromas meet with mossy earth and a bit of barnyard funk. The palate is sour and gamy.

title: Calvet 2015 Brut Rosé  (Crémant de Bordeaux)
description: Almost entirely Cabernet Franc with a little help from Merlot, this is a soft and fruity wine. With its strawberry fruit, light acidity and smooth texture, the wine is easy and ready to drink.

title: It's a Headsnapper 2015 Radiant Red (California)
description: Spicy oak accents meet jammy grapey fruit flavors in this medium-bodied, richly textured and lightly sweet wine.

title: Koenig Vineyards 2014 Cuvée Amelia Reserve Syrah
description: Aromas of dried cranberry, cherry and barrel spice lead to slightly dried out fruit and meaty flavors. It seems quite evolved for its age and the barrel influence heavy handed.

title: Koenig Vineyards 2014 Reserve Petit Verdot-Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot Red
description: This wine is a blend of 55% Petit Verdot, 35% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Merlot. The aromas are unusual, with notes of wood, char, cigar box, game and slightly dried out seeming fruit. The flavors are light and compact, with smoky flavors on the finish.

title: Luigi Bosca 2017 Las Compuertas Riesling (Mendoza)
description: Aromas of vanilla cookies, lanolin and lemon peel are more dull than vivid. This warm-climate Riesling feels citric and drawing. Lemony flavors include a note of orange peel. The wine tastes briny on the finish.

title: Producta Vignobles 2015 Mission Saint-Vincent Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon  (Bordeaux)
description: This soft and fruity wine is made for drinking now. Gentle black fruits, pleasant acidity and easy tannins are all conducive to instant accessibility. No aging is needed here.

title: Roza Ridge 2015 Petit Verdot (Rattlesnake Hills)
description: The aromas are quite green in tones of savory herbs and green flowers in front of cherry and spice. The palate brings a big blast of acidity that carries through the finish.

title: Sanglier Cellars 2014 Boar's Camp Proprietary Red (Sonoma County)
description: This medium-bodied blend of 42% Syrah, 29% Grenache and 29% Mourvèdre is earthy, floral and pungently rustic, with a kick of greenness on the back palate.

title: Snoqualmie 2015 Whistle Stop Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Aromas of pickling and baking spice along with plum are followed by a plush palate that mixes equal parts fruit and barrel. A vanilla marks the finish of this straightforward quaffer.

title: Callaway 2014 Winemaker's Reserve Syrah (Temecula Valley)
description: Stewed red fruits, sweet sagebrush and anise show on the nose of this bottling. Rustic flavors of cooked boysenberries and pomegranate are cut by a slightly sour funkiness.

title: Cerulean 2013 Acadia Vineyards Tempranillo (Columbia Gorge (WA))
description: Light in color, the aromas offer notes of pencil eraser and cherry. The flavors are quite light in style, with the concentration dialed way back.

title: Château de Valmier 2016  Vouvray
description: Lightly off-dry, this wine is gently fruity with quince and pear flavors. A hint of honey and almonds brings out the soft texture. The wine has a crisp, fresh aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Alamos 2016 Torrontés (Salta)
description: Aromas of lychee and pine lead to a palate with moderate acidity. Briny green melon and stone-fruit flavors are lasting on a finish that tastes a touch sugary. Drink right away.

title: Basel Cellars 2015 Malbec (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Baking spice, green herbs, tire rubber, vanilla and slightly dried out blue fruit aromas lead to lighter styled flavors that seem very woody. It doesn't all come together on the palate.

title: Inurrieta 2013 Puro Vicio Syrah (Navarra)
description: Lemony oak aromas are burnt and crispy, with foresty fruit notes lurking in the backdrop. This Syrah is big and blocky, with lemony acidity. Flavors of tart black plum, pepper, coffee and burnt wood finish blackened, with lasting lemony acidity creating length.

title: Maryhill 2014 Elephant Mountain Vineyards Carmenère (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The aromas show notes of herb, green pepper and barrel spice. The flavors are light but plush in feel, with a cherry note on the finish.

title: Merriam 2013 Gloeckner-Turner Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Rockpile)
description: There's not much on the nose of this wine, which is made from grapes grown at 1,300-feet in elevation in the wilds above Healdsburg. On the palate, features of leather, big black currant, graphite and oak combine around sizable tannins that pucker on the finish.

title: Santa Julia 2017 Organic Torrontés (Mendoza)
description: Highly tropical aromas of mango and lychee suggest air freshener. This wine feels bland, with low acidity and no edginess. Lychee and pyrazinic flavors turn slightly bitter on the finish.

title: Twin Cedars 2014 Petit Verdot (Rattlesnake Hills)
description: Aromas of vanilla, anise, cherry and green wood are followed by light, simple fruit flavors. Drink now.

title: Wayland 2016 Red (California)
description: This wine has a lot of candied-fruit aromas and almost-sweet cherry flavors accented by vanilla and butter. It has a soft texture and very little tannin or acidity.

title: Domaine Roman 2016 Pinot Noir (Pays d'Oc)
description: Aromas of red currants and strawberries unfold on the nose of this straightforward, easy-drinking wine. It's bright and juicy, with touches of sweet oak and vanilla on the close. Drink now.

title: Ca' Momi 2016 Heartcraft Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Sweet, honeyed and confectionery, this wine is for fans of the style: light-bodied and tasting of baked tropical fruit.

title: Château Moulin de Clotte 2016 L'Authentique  (Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux)
description: Called authentic because there is no added sulphur, this wine is all fruit, without any wood aging. On the palate, it is juicy, packed with acidity and red-fruit flavors. The aftertaste brings out a metallic, tight edge to the wine.

title: Fallon Place 2015 Landa Vineyard Zinfandel (Chalk Hill)
description: From a small 40-year-old site in the appellation, this wine presents as stewy and overly ripe in ways that don't complement. Plum and leather poke through sizable sticky tannin.

title: La Fleur Ribeyrolles 2015  Bordeaux Supérieur
description: This ripe blend with 60% Merlot is jammy, soft and full of red berries. Its light structure and generally crisp and fresh texture make it an easy, fruity wine ready to drink now.

title: Latah Creek 2016 Familigia Vineyard Riesling (Ancient Lakes)
description: The aromas are a bit light for the variety and all high toned, with notes of white flower, cider and peach. It drinks medium sweet, with tangy acidity.
